trans-unit.resname: EDIT YOUR QUESTION<span class="sub_title">Want to change your question? You can do that here. Remember, proper grammar and correct spelling increase your chances of getting a great answer!
trans-unit.source: EDIT YOUR QUESTION <span class="sub_title">Want to change your question? You can do that here. Remember, proper grammar and correct spelling increase your chances of getting a great answer!
trans-unit.target: 编辑您的问题 <span class=”sub_title”>想要更改您的问题吗？您可以在这里更改。谨记，正确的语法和正确的拼写可以增加成为优秀回答的机会！

trans-unit.resname: GUIDELINESTo ask a great HealthTap question, use these helpful guidelines
trans-unit.source: GUIDELINES To ask a great HealthTap question, use these helpful guidelines
trans-unit.target: 指南 要提出一个优秀的HealthTap问题，请使用这些有帮助的指南

trans-unit.resname:
Sweat the details... at least a little.Hide examples
Good:I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good:Why do I have a rash?
trans-unit.source:
Sweat the details... at least a little. Hide examples
Good: I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good: Why do I have a rash?
trans-unit.target:
更多的细节...至少有一点。隐藏范例
好：在过去3个星期里，为什么我的手肘内部一直瘙痒，进而导致干性皮疹？这可能由什么引起？
不太好： 为什么我患上了皮疹？

trans-unit.resname:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers.Show examples
Good:What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good:Why back pain?
trans-unit.source:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers. Show examples
Good: What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good: Why back pain?
trans-unit.target:
使（您的问题描述）尽可能长这样可以帮助到其他人。因为世界各地有成千上万的人可能会读您的问题和其相应的回答。显示范例
好： 是什么导致在家里做家务后会后背疼 - 我的背部从来没有受过伤？
差： 什么背疼？

trans-unit.resname:
Include sex/gender, when relevant.Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful:What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary:What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?
trans-unit.source:
Include sex/gender, when relevant. Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful: What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary: What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?
trans-unit.target:
当相关时，包括性别。显示范例
性别有帮助:什么可能导致男人胸部下面一个四分之一大小的肿块？
不需要性别：在我的手背皮肤上。这个类似橡胶凸起，果冻豆的大小的东西是什么？

trans-unit.resname:
Include an approximate age.Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers:For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?
trans-unit.source:
Include an approximate age. Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers: For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?
trans-unit.target:
包括一个适当的年龄。显示范例
不同的年龄段有不同的回答： 前两天，我15岁的儿子发烧了，而且走路一瘸一拐的，好像腿受了伤一样。哪些东西可能导致这种情况？
为什么前两天我3岁的孩子发着烧，走路还一瘸一拐，好像腿受了一样呢？使问题尽可能的对其他人是有帮助的。

trans-unit.resname:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant.Show examples
Good:My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good:My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?
trans-unit.source:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant. Show examples
Good: My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good: My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?
trans-unit.target:
只要是相关的，包括体重、身高以及计量单位。显示范例
好：我3岁大的儿子，重27磅，高34英尺。在他这个年龄这个身高体重正常吗？
差：我3岁大的儿子，重27磅，高34英尺。在他这个年龄正常吗？

trans-unit.resname:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication.Show examples
Good:My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good:My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?
trans-unit.source:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication. Show examples
Good: My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good: My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?
trans-unit.target:
请同时使用药物的商标名和通用（仿制药）名称，尤其当您不在美国或问及不常见的药物时。显示范例
好：我5岁大的儿子，55磅，正在发烧。他服用5ml的泰诺（对乙酰氨基酚120mg / 5ml），但还在发烧。体重和年龄这么大的孩子可以服用更大剂量的泰诺吗？
差:我的儿子5岁，体重55，有一点发烧。已服用过泰诺但还在发烧。服用更多泰诺吗？

trans-unit.resname:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer.Show examples
Good:How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good:Do antibiotics work in children?
trans-unit.source:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer. Show examples
Good: How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good: Do antibiotics work in children?
trans-unit.target:
尽量避免提问一些医生回答“是”或者“不是”的问题。显示范例
好：抗生素如何在年幼的学龄儿童中起作用？
差：抗生素对儿童起作用吗？

trans-unit.resname:
Try to leave opinions out.Show examples
Good:Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good:Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?
trans-unit.source:
Try to leave opinions out. Show examples
Good: Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good: Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?
trans-unit.target:
尝试不要发表意见显示范例
好： 为什么有些人会抵抗疫苗，明明疫苗可以用来预防疾病？
差：那些反疫苗的人是彻底地不懂还是只是拒绝接受？

trans-unit.resname:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang.Show examples
Good:I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good:Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?
trans-unit.source:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang. Show examples
Good: I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good: Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?
trans-unit.target:
越清楚越好。运用好语法，不要说脏话和俚语。显示范例
好：我当时正在锻炼手臂，然后感到二头肌处有火烧一样的疼痛。我是肌肉撕裂了吗？
差：做弯举，感觉不对和胳膊受伤？

trans-unit.resname:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions.Show examples
Good:My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good:And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?
trans-unit.source:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions. Show examples
Good: My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good: And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?
trans-unit.target:
不要假设个人的病史知识。HealthTap的医生经常不会看到您以前的问题。显示范例
好： 我两岁的儿子两个月前得了耳管炎，现在还发烧了，右耳会流脓。这正常吗？
差： 这种症状已经持续两天，也一直有脓流出来吗？

trans-unit.resname:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue).Show examples
Good:I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good:Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.
trans-unit.source:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue). Show examples
Good: I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good: Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.
trans-unit.target:
为了保护隐私，请不要留下您的姓名和他人的姓名（“其他”除已公开谈论某个问题的名人的名字）。显示范例
好：我叫John Doe，我比较好奇是否有针对帕金森综合征的有效治疗方法。在过去三年里有新的，好的治疗方法面世吗？
差： 您好，医生。我叫John Doe，我比较好奇是否有针对帕金森综合征的有效治疗方法。

trans-unit.resname:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing.Show examples
Good:How do you know if you are pregnant, if you never have regular periods?
Not so good:How do u no ur prego if u never have reg periods?
trans-unit.source:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing. Show examples
Good: How do you know if you are pregnant, if you never have regular periods?
Not so good: How do u no ur prego if u never have reg periods?
trans-unit.target:
避免使用太多的缩写，因为可能导致混淆显示范例
好：如果您没有来生理周期，您是如何知道您怀孕了？
差：如果您没有周期，如何知道怀了？

trans-unit.resname:
Ask in English. This is the language commonly used by doctors on HealthTap.Show examples
Good:I pruned some trees last weekend and my arm has been hurting for 2 days. Could this be the cause?
Not so good:Porque mi brazo me duele mucho esta semana?
trans-unit.source:
Ask in English. This is the language commonly used by doctors on HealthTap. Show examples
Good: I pruned some trees last weekend and my arm has been hurting for 2 days. Could this be the cause?
Not so good: Porque mi brazo me duele mucho esta semana?
trans-unit.target:
用英语询问。这是HealthTap医生的常用语言。显示范例
好：我上周末修剪了一些树木，我的手臂已经疼了2天。这可能由什么引起？
差：Porque mi brazo me duele mucho esta semana?

trans-unit.resname:
RateRx is a new, independent resource for doctors and patients alike, that presents ratings of medication effectiveness as reported by thousands of U.S.-licensed doctors in clinical practice of more than 137 specialties. RateRx represents the first comprehensive assessment of what experienced clinicians in each specialty actually use in the care of patients with specific conditions. Unlike other studies, which may report on the clinical effectiveness of treatments under controlled circumstances, RateRx calls on the deep, long-term, real-world experience of top doctors to reveal which treatments doctors have learned actually work with patients.

Doctors were asked to rate the clinical effectiveness of a drug for treating a condition on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. Contributing doctors gave ratings to medications for their use with specific indications based on their knowledge and were instructed to provide input based only on clinical experience using the drug for that indication. We summarized the combined ratings for each treatment into an aggregate rating reflecting doctors’ collective experiences. The profiles of all doctors who provided ratings are visible to users, who can review details of the doctors’ training and experiences, including their specialties and board certifications.

Participation in this study was open to all U.S.-licensed doctors in good standing. All 66,000 doctors in HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network were encouraged to participate. In addition, HealthTap invited more than 500,000 U.S. licensed doctors in our extended network to participate. Doctors are able to enter effectiveness ratings for medications that treat any condition, and can enter and add ratings for any new medication treatments not already included.

RateRx results display each treatment for an indication in an ordered rank based on average ratings, from highest rated to lowest. When differences between the ratings of alternative treatments are deemed meaningful based on the amount of data presented.

To ensure unbiased doctor evaluations, doctors do not see their colleagues’ existing contributions until after they have entered their own rating. Recommendations cannot be changed once submitted, but after ratings are submitted, doctors can view the ratings of other doctors and comment on these. Both patients and doctors can learn from the RateRx ratings system. Patients benefit from the collective wisdom shared by these doctors, enabling them to see how different treatments for the same conditions are rated and reviewed. Doctors benefit from their colleagues’ ratings and comments, and are able to interpret them by referring to the contributing doctors’ practice profiles (which show their education and experience, their specialty training, years in practice, DocScore, and their “Known for” topics).

Comments, which are optional, are often used by doctors to qualify or explain ratings, or to share details of how medications are used for each indication. Comments are available to read and review, do not change the numeric value of the rating. Ratings are based on generic drug names, but brand names are presented to permit doctors to rate specific drugs. Brand names are shown for every generic medication name presented. This study does not differentiate ratings between different brand names for the same medication. The most common medication treatments for each condition are listed for ratings, but doctors are encouraged to add treatments for any indication, ensuring the inclusion of new or novel treatments for each condition. Doctors were instructed to add medications not previously on the list of standard treatment only if they had experience using the medication to treat the condition at issue and found these medication effective in the treatment of that condition.

Okay
trans-unit.source:
RateRx is a new, independent resource for doctors and patients alike, that presents ratings of medication effectiveness as reported by thousands of U.S.-licensed doctors in clinical practice of more than 137 specialties. RateRx represents the first comprehensive assessment of what experienced clinicians in each specialty actually use in the care of patients with specific conditions. Unlike other studies, which may report on the clinical effectiveness of treatments under controlled circumstances, RateRx calls on the deep, long-term, real-world experience of top doctors to reveal which treatments doctors have learned actually work with patients.

Doctors were asked to rate the clinical effectiveness of a drug for treating a condition on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. Contributing doctors gave ratings to medications for their use with specific indications based on their knowledge and were instructed to provide input based only on clinical experience using the drug for that indication. We summarized the combined ratings for each treatment into an aggregate rating reflecting doctors’ collective experiences. The profiles of all doctors who provided ratings are visible to users, who can review details of the doctors’ training and experiences, including their specialties and board certifications.

Participation in this study was open to all U.S.-licensed doctors in good standing. All 66,000 doctors in HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network were encouraged to participate. In addition, HealthTap invited more than 500,000 U.S. licensed doctors in our extended network to participate. Doctors are able to enter effectiveness ratings for medications that treat any condition, and can enter and add ratings for any new medication treatments not already included.

RateRx results display each treatment for an indication in an ordered rank based on average ratings, from highest rated to lowest. When differences between the ratings of alternative treatments are deemed meaningful based on the amount of data presented.

To ensure unbiased doctor evaluations, doctors do not see their colleagues’ existing contributions until after they have entered their own rating. Recommendations cannot be changed once submitted, but after ratings are submitted, doctors can view the ratings of other doctors and comment on these. Both patients and doctors can learn from the RateRx ratings system. Patients benefit from the collective wisdom shared by these doctors, enabling them to see how different treatments for the same conditions are rated and reviewed. Doctors benefit from their colleagues’ ratings and comments, and are able to interpret them by referring to the contributing doctors’ practice profiles (which show their education and experience, their specialty training, years in practice, DocScore, and their “Known for” topics).

Comments, which are optional, are often used by doctors to qualify or explain ratings, or to share details of how medications are used for each indication. Comments are available to read and review, do not change the numeric value of the rating. Ratings are based on generic drug names, but brand names are presented to permit doctors to rate specific drugs. Brand names are shown for every generic medication name presented. This study does not differentiate ratings between different brand names for the same medication. The most common medication treatments for each condition are listed for ratings, but doctors are encouraged to add treatments for any indication, ensuring the inclusion of new or novel treatments for each condition. Doctors were instructed to add medications not previously on the list of standard treatment only if they had experience using the medication to treat the condition at issue and found these medication effective in the treatment of that condition.

Okay
trans-unit.target:
RateRx代表了第一个针对有经验的医生在他们各自的专业领域所使用的治疗特定情况患者的手段的全面性评估。与其他研究在特定的情况下评价治疗有效性不同的是，RateRx希望获得顶级医生深入而长期的实际经验来获取最佳治疗方法。推荐一旦被提交就无法更改，但是在提交打分之后，医生可以查看其它医生的评分并进行评论。患者可以从这种医生集体智慧中受益，让他们能够看到对相同症状的不同治疗方式是如何被评分与评价的。打分是基于药品的通用（仿制药）名称的，但是也会显示品牌名称，准许医生对特定的药品进行评分。该调查不会区分不同品牌的药物对同一种药物治疗方式的评分。

好

trans-unit.resname:
These terms (the “Free Trial Terms”) govern the offer (the “Prime Free Trial Offer”) by HealthTap to New Qualified Users to access to the HealthTap Prime Service upon signing up and submitting payment information for a new HealthTap Prime account (the “Free Trial Period”). By submitting your payment details, you accept the Prime Free-Trial Offer and: (i) consent to our use of your payment information in accordance with our Payment Details Terms, and (ii) acknowledge and agree to the HealthTapTerms of Useand these Free Trial Terms. If you decide that you do not want to become a paying user of HealthTap Prime under the standard HealthTap Prime Terms in effect at the end of the Free Trial Period, you must cancel your HealthTap Prime Subscription (in the Billing Settings section of your HealthTap accountSettings) before the end of the Free Trial Period. Subscription fees are not prorated; cancellations after the termination of the Free Trial Period will remain active through the end of the trial length period during which the account is canceled. You may only use this Free Trial Offer once. HealthTap reserves the right, in its absolute discretion, to determine individual eligibility for this Prime Free-Trial Offer and to withdraw or to modify this Prime Trial Offer and/or the Free Trial Terms at any time, without prior notice and with no liability.

Payment Details Terms: When you sign up for a trial or any of our Premium Services, or make other purchases through the Apps, your credit card information and other financial data needed to process your payment are collected and stored by third party payment processors, and we may collect some limited information, such as your postal code and transaction history details. The use of your data by any such third party payment processors is subject to their privacy policies. These third parties generally provide us with some limited information (such as a unique token that enables you to make additional purchases using the information they’ve stored, and your card’s type, expiration date, and last four digits).

See the HealthTapTerms of Usefor the definitions of “HealthTap,” “HealthTap Prime,” “Apps,” and “Premium Services.” “New Qualified Users” means new HealthTap Prime customers without a prior primary or sub-account or trial account on HealthTap Prime.

Please note that the following prescriptions are not currently available via HealthTap Prime: narcotics or DEA controlled substances (Schedule I, II, III, IV), psychiatric or lifestyle medications (such as diet or erectile dysfunction drugs), or medications restricted by individual states.
trans-unit.source:
These terms (the “Free Trial Terms”) govern the offer (the “Prime Free Trial Offer”) by HealthTap to New Qualified Users to access to the HealthTap Prime Service upon signing up and submitting payment information for a new HealthTap Prime account (the “Free Trial Period”). By submitting your payment details, you accept the Prime Free-Trial Offer and: (i) consent to our use of your payment information in accordance with our Payment Details Terms, and (ii) acknowledge and agree to the HealthTap Terms of Use and these Free Trial Terms. If you decide that you do not want to become a paying user of HealthTap Prime under the standard HealthTap Prime Terms in effect at the end of the Free Trial Period, you must cancel your HealthTap Prime Subscription (in the Billing Settings section of your HealthTap account Settings) before the end of the Free Trial Period. Subscription fees are not prorated; cancellations after the termination of the Free Trial Period will remain active through the end of the trial length period during which the account is canceled. You may only use this Free Trial Offer once. HealthTap reserves the right, in its absolute discretion, to determine individual eligibility for this Prime Free-Trial Offer and to withdraw or to modify this Prime Trial Offer and/or the Free Trial Terms at any time, without prior notice and with no liability.

Payment Details Terms: When you sign up for a trial or any of our Premium Services, or make other purchases through the Apps, your credit card information and other financial data needed to process your payment are collected and stored by third party payment processors, and we may collect some limited information, such as your postal code and transaction history details. The use of your data by any such third party payment processors is subject to their privacy policies. These third parties generally provide us with some limited information (such as a unique token that enables you to make additional purchases using the information they’ve stored, and your card’s type, expiration date, and last four digits).

See the HealthTap Terms of Use for the definitions of “HealthTap,” “HealthTap Prime,” “Apps,” and “Premium Services.” “New Qualified Users” means new HealthTap Prime customers without a prior primary or sub-account or trial account on HealthTap Prime.

Please note that the following prescriptions are not currently available via HealthTap Prime: narcotics or DEA controlled substances (Schedule I, II, III, IV), psychiatric or lifestyle medications (such as diet or erectile dysfunction drugs), or medications restricted by individual states.

trans-unit.resname: Donate to charity and we'll give you 50 extra characters to ask your question! Your proceeds go to one of many charities HealthTap supports, including:Operation Smile,Doctors Without Borders,American Red Cross,Susan G. Komen for the Cure,Direct Relief International,African Medical & Research Foundation (AMREF),Against Malaria Foundation,Nurse Family Partnership,Naya Health,Schistosomiasis Control Initiative (SCI),MAP International, orGlobal Partners for Development.

Komen for the Cure, Direct Relief International, African Medical & Research Foundation (AMREF), Against Malaria Foundation, Nurse Family Partnership, Naya Health, Schistosomiasis Control Initiative (SCI), MAP International, or Global Partners for Development.
